body: Also `toString()` (internally `outerHtml()`) fails on this. So it seems to be a serious problem.

issue.title: Added Null Check to avoid NPE for shallow Clones

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
When doing operations on Shallow Node (type-casted to Element) such as toString(), I am getting a NullPointerException. 

While debugging I found Element.isInlineable(Document.OutputSettings) line 1619 calls parent().isBlock(). 
In our case, a shallow clone cannot have a parent. So I have added a Null check.

Note - I found out that this issue has already been raised. Existing issue Link - https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/1410

issue.title: Fix NullpointerException in Element.isInlineable()

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
Regression, introduced in 3a9bf46eeb36196d841c3fa05597e40a13f51f43 .

`parent()` will be `null` for freshly cloned, created or removed `Element`s.

body: Thanks all. This was fixed with 77fcaf4dcdc8fd185e2f5d8eb6aa9c425a38bc9b. In particular, adding the nullability annotations created a warning for this issue.

issue.title: Regression introduced when upgrading from 1.12.1 to 1.13.1

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This is a duplicate issue or root-cause of another issue

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
Only version upgraded then:

```kotlin
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.jsoup.nodes.Element.isInlineable(Element.java:1619)
        at org.jsoup.nodes.Element.outerHtmlHead(Element.java:1479)
        at org.jsoup.nodes.Node$OuterHtmlVisitor.head(Node.java:740)
        at org.jsoup.select.NodeTraversor.traverse(NodeTraversor.java:25)
        at org.jsoup.nodes.Node.outerHtml(Node.java:606)
        at org.jsoup.nodes.Node.outerHtml(Node.java:601)
        at org.jsoup.nodes.Node.toString(Node.java:635)
        at com.cognifide.gradle.aem.common.pkg.vault.FilterElement.toString(FilterElement.kt:37)
        at com.cognifide.gradle.aem.common.pkg.vault.VaultDefinition.getFilters(VaultDefinition.kt:80)
        at com.cognifide.gradle.aem.common.pkg.vault.VaultDefinition$Del
```

Related code / I am using Jsoup as markup builder: https://github.com/Cognifide/gradle-aem-plugin/blob/master/src/main/kotlin/com/cognifide/gradle/aem/common/pkg/vault/FilterElement.kt#L19-L37

issue.title: Upcoming - release jsoup 1.14.1

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
I'm looking to transition my code away from the Whitelist class, to the Safelist class, which was introduced in jsoup 1.14.

More info in the Whitelist class: https://jsoup.org/apidocs/org/jsoup/safety/Whitelist.html

My code uses Maven to manage its dependencies, and the newest version of jsoup available to Maven seems to be 1.13: https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.jsoup/jsoup

What's the process for updating the Maven repository with a newer version of jsoup?
